result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kera D. Skibba in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CF353, 15CF252, 15CF253, 16CF177, 16CF185, 16CF337 & 14CM374.

11:39 a.m.  Atty Knaapen calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Atty Knaapen indicates that the sentencing will take place at a later date but plea's are to be entered on all cases, except 14CF353. 
Atty Knaapen states partial plea agreement on the record.
Atty Sheets states that the agreement stated by Atty Knaapen is a correct statement.
Court requests that the parties provide written statement on what the sentencing agreement stated on the record is.
Atty Sheets makes additional statements.
Atty Sheets waives reading of the amended information(s) provided by the State.
BTC:  Not Guilty plea's are entered on 14CF353 in regards to  the amended information.
Atty Sheets makes a statement that he has met with his client and reviewed each and every plea questionnaire.
Atty Sheets clarifies for the Court that the parties have agreed to defer judgment on Count 1 of 16CF337, Count 1 of 16CF177 and Count 1 of 15CF252.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF353 - PLEA TO BE DONE AT THE TIME OF THE SENTENCING HEARING
Amended information provided by the State
Count 1 -
Count 2 -
Count 3 -

15CF252 (State provides an amended information for Count 2):
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - No contest 
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI
Count 5 - No contest 

15CF253:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI

16CF177:
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI
Count 5 - DRI

16CF185:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI

16CF337:
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI
Count 5 - DRI
Count 6 - No contest 

14CM374:
Count 1 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.


BY THE COURT:
Parties will need to set a sentencing hearing with the Branch 2 Judicial Assistant.
Sentencing hearing on February 22, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
from Pre-Trial Supervision Program Case Manager - original filed in 14CF353
Plea hearing on January 20, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Kera D. Skibba in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CF353, 15CF252, 15CF253, 16CF177, 16CF185, 16CF337 and 14CM374.

2:36  p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Atty Knaapen indicates that there had been a plea agreement but there are some medical concerns of the defendant and they will be requesting and adjournment.
Atty Sheets makes statements that his client is in a high risk pregnancy and would request an adjournment of these cases.
Court would request a letter from a physician and makes further statements.
Court would like this case re-scheduled for a plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 20, 2017 at 11:00 am.

from Clerk re: phone call with defendant re: new wage assignment
Preliminary hearing at 08-03-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Kera D. Skibba in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CF252 and 15CF253.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
BTC: 15CF253 is covered by bond of 15CF252  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

This bond covers both files 15CF253 & 15CF252.  Cash bond $500 and pay first $200 cash and then a payment of $100 from each Evolve Health check.   Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.    Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.    Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  7 times per week.   Do not have contact with Devin Lettau, Unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.
